title: Cant use a champ in ranked unless mastery 4+
body: Can we please make this a thing, i mean serisouly at least have some sort of experience on the champion you are palying before playing the thing. im sick of seeing lbs/yas/vaynes that think because the champ i strong that they cant lose. please do it for the poor souls stuck with support and cant carry their teams.

replies.body:
I'm just gonna start counting every stupid idea I see on the boards 

My  bet: 100 at the end of the month

More often than not you're not stuck with support, people choose to play it so I think that's an invalid point.
Yes ideally you should have experience with a champ before ranked but mastery 4 doesn't prove you're good with that champ. It just shows you've played that champ a lot and racked up the points you could still be bad with them.
Is this post based on the fact you had a yas who died 18 times? Why didn't you buy mikaels to deal with Elise cocoon, Leona stuns or Noc fear? That item may have effected the outcome i don't know i can only make conclusion based upon last game stats. Why run armour pen and magic pen on Ali? Surely you'd want to be tankier?

What if you get auto filled lets say you main mid and get auto filled Jungle. What then? do you luckily have a flex pick or a Master 4 Zac at the ready? What if you main top and get Autofilled ADC? do you just Yasuo ADC because you don't have a mastery 4 ADC?
Support is a role definately capable of carrying a team, NOT every game lets be reasonable someone goes 0/18 you try hard take the L and move on. But i've seen Morgana's break open a game i've seen blitzcranks put 4 people on his back and cho choo to fucking victory, countless zyra's 2v1ing the botlane. As with every role the better you get the harder you climb, very FEW people are stuck with support the ones who are autofilled. Everyone else chooses to be in that positions one way or another. Sounds like you just need to start moving mountains for your team
exactly.

I have to add that because most people cannot play support to any acceptable standard in low elo, if you main support, that's one less useless person on your team and odds are that if your adc is average or better (unless they go full ap deathcap garen, then you're fucked) you'll almost always win botlane and if they're a potato, you'll probably still go even. Because of this you'll probably end up drifting to around low silver if you play enough games even if everything about you screams bronze, if you can play support it does help you climb alot, simply because all the other people stuck in support don't know what they're doing.

no offence, i dont mind playing support every few games but firstly, if i rank up playing support i would never ever feel accomplished and secondly after the third game playing support, its gets fcking boring..

hahaha none taken, I completely agree with the lack of a sense of accomplishment because of the fact that I don't think I've ever solo carried. I disagree that support is boring however since the role can vary so much from babysitting an incompetent adc so they don't feed, all the way to balls to the walls aggression for the mechanically amazing adcs, to zone the enemy botlane and setup kills and snowball the lane as fast as I possibly can, so they can end laning phase fed and carry. In lanes where the adc is passive and just wants to farm, I find nothing more exciting than rushing to midlane as soon as both botlane backs to do the the lvl4 roam to hopefully kill the enemy midlane and to put them on a hilarious tilt streak where they flame their jungler in allchat about how the support has ganked their lane more than the jungler ect...

But I could do all these things in Mid, Top and sometimes even ADC. Roaming isn't only for supports and adapting your style to your teammates and enemy's definitely isn't just for supports. Support can be ok for like a game but I honestly I never autofill these days because you just always get shoved into supporting. Different personality's just fit different roles I think.
hahaha both true.
yes! thats one reason i do play support a bit because then you get an autofill giving you your designated role which is rlly good and it gives incentive to play support.
I'm a support main so it's Win/Win for me :D

No, your wrong and no offence i am so against this. I don't have mastery 4+ on many champs that i can play fine in a ranked game and so will that mean i cant playthem in ranked because i haven't spammed them in norms???

> [{quoted}](name=KawtYouNow,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=KEjW3fYq,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-10-11T22:01:27.354+0000)
>
> No, your wrong and no offence i am so against this. I don't have mastery 4+ on many champs that i can play fine in a ranked game and so will that mean i cant playthem in ranked because i haven't spammed them in norms???

Winning 20 games with a champions BEFORE hitting the ranked queue with them is not "spam", but the barely adequate minimum training in order to play with them ... 

as it is now, I can try my wacky ideas for galio/irelia/rengar support at ANY point in RANKED games and without any prior training in those champions, but you wouldn't like me to be your teammate in a ranked game when trying those, would you .?. ;) 

And indeed I have done so, at least for Galio ... not a single game with him in 2 years and I was allowed to play him immediately in ranked ... seems a bit silly to me ... I mean, imagine hitting the football pitch with brand new shoes, on the day of the actual official game **and only at that CRITICAL moment you realise that you cannot play with those new shoes !**

Isn't it much more reasonable to try them BEFOREHAND, then .?. :)

This rule would work better in somewhere with more players, like NA, since you wont get autofilled until like diamond+. 

I agree with the post if it was just the 2 roles that you picked. Mastery 4 is literally like 10 wins. I wouldn't want to play with someone who doesn't even have that on their champion in their main/secondary role.
i was told to play cho jg as my champ got banned and hes ez af to play in jg. I dont have like any wins on him

Honestly, mastery 6+ would make more sense since it actually requires a degree of skill to achieve and, more importantly, can't be achieved through ARAM/Featured modes (which are  completely different environments compared to ranked). Would actually promote people learning to play the champion, to some degree, before using them in ranked.

So im thinking jsut so4 time on the champ that they want to play. idc if they are good, ijsut want them to know what abilitiws they have and what they do lol.

Maybe so, but it would be far better for everyone involved if it were a skill based requirement rather than a progression based requirement. We already have 2 progression based requirements for Ranked (level 30 and 16 champs), we don't need a third. What really needs to happen is some kind of skill based requirement (this is something people have been saying for years), to promote people learning the champs they want to play in ranked and actually have a better understanding of how they work as a result. Logically, it would significantly increase the experience of ranked for everyone involved and might even "eliminate" the argument of "elo hell".

That sounds annoying as fuck for people that don't play enough, so hell no. I only have one Mastery 5 champion because I don't play alot and I haven't gotten 6 on them because ive been playing other champions. So pretty much you want me to not play ranked.

Realistically, if Riot were to implement such a system they'd give ample warning that it's going to happen (maybe 3-6 months or so) so that people have the opportunity to get the champions they want to play to mastery 6. In the end, the main point I'm getting at is that it would be a more skill based requirement, which many people agree is something that is needed for ranked.
I still think new ranked players should start 0lp in b5.

> [{quoted}](name=Essembie,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=KEjW3fYq,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-10-12T02:18:52.873+0000)
>
> I still think new ranked players should start 0lp in b5.

Would you still think that if you hadn't dropped from S2 down to B4 though?

I think the should only let players with certain amount of normal wins so they could have at least some experience. I've met plenty of people with 100 wins and have no idea how the game works. It pisses me off.
But what about people who level a second account? I've also come across people with 500 wins and they still have no idea.

Being on the OCE server I think an easier solution is normal draft pick. It might seem obvious but that way people could practice new champions guaranteed in their role, rather than hoping you get it in out current normal blinds. As it is we don't have the player population and that which we currently have would be even further limited. Imagine ban stage, the trolls would have a field day.
